title: 31.782 DEFINITIONS.
text:
As used in sections 31.781 to 31.789, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them.
[Repealed, 1996 c 310 s 1]
"Perishable food" means any food intended for human consumption (other than meat and poultry, frozen food, or fresh fruit or vegetables), which has a quality assurance date.
"Quality assurance date" means any date after which the manufacturer or processor reasonably determines that the product may, by spoilage, wiltage, drying or any other foreseeable and normal natural phenomenon, lose its palatability or its desired or nutritive properties. The date shall include the day, month, and, if appropriate, the year.
